payload.name: systems-thinking
payload.core: Reason about interacting components whose behavior over time cannot be predicted from parts alone. Core primitives: reinforcing loops (R), balancing loops (B), delays, stocks, and emergence.
proc: Define problem dynamically: state undesired behavior pattern over time
Identify 5-15 key variables; name stocks explicitly
Trace loops back to origin; even sign flips = R, odd = B
Insert delays where effect lags cause > 1 time unit
Locate leverage points: structure changes > parameter changes
Write dynamic hypothesis: problem pattern + dominant loop + condition + consequence
Validate: predict novel scenario; check against data or simulation
check: Every loop labeled R/B with descriptive name
At least one stock with inflow/outflow named
Delays marked where lag > 1 time unit

diff.mechanistic: Mechanistic = how component works inside; Systems = how components interact over time for emergent patterns
diff.model-based-simulation: Simulation runs quantitative models forward; Systems builds qualitative structure (loops, delays) first
diff.qualitative: Qualitative = directional sign propagation; Systems adds loop closure and delay analysis
diff.counterfactual: Counterfactual asks what-if; Systems asks what structure causes behavior

fail.mode: Vague loop stories without measurable hypotheses
fail.signal: Cannot name stocks, specify dominant loop, or state falsifiable prediction
mit: Require at least one stock with units and initial value
Name dominant loop: under [condition], loop [name] dominates
Specify delay magnitude: order-of-magnitude lag with evidence
Derive falsifiable prediction with measurable variable and timeframe

use: Org design: hiring velocity, onboarding capacity, incentives
Markets: supply/demand, network effects, platform ecosystems
Reliability engineering: alert fatigue, incident cascades, capacity planning
Long-term planning: policy resistance, unintended consequences

rel.name: mechanistic
rel.note: use before systems to understand parts

rel.name: model-based-simulation
rel.note: use after systems to run scenarios

rel.name: counterfactual
rel.note: queries alternate histories using systems model

ex.problem: Why does on-call team burn out despite hiring?

loops.name: R1
loops.label: Burnout spiral
loops.path: high load -> burnout -> attrition -> fewer people -> higher load

loops.name: B1
loops.label: Hiring response
loops.path: high load -> visible pain -> hiring approved -> new hires -> lower load

ex.delay: New hires take 3 months to ramp up
ex.hypothesis: R1 dominates when hiring delayed or ramp-up > 2 months, causing attrition to outpace hiring
ex.prediction: If ramp-up cut to 1 month, attrition drops within 6 months
